result.execSummary:
The defendant Rob Wayne Graves was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent to 15CF103.
Defendant to report to Probation today August 24, 2015 no later than 4:00 p.m.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: to 15CF103

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Kenneth N. Sortedahl   DF ATTY:  Alex Stormont   DF:  Rob Wayne Graves appeared.  Court called at 11:17 a.m.  Attorney Stormont advises there is an agreement.  DE files a plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights.  Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty in 15CF103. DE pleads Guilty to Ct 2 in 15CF103.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds the DE adjudicated Guilty of Ct 2 in 15CF103. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct. 1 & Ct. 3 in 15CF103.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty in 15CF259.  DE pleads Guilty to Ct. 1 in 15CF259.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds the DE adjudicated Guilty of Ct. 1 15CF259.   Sentencing arguments. DE makes statement.  Crt orders:  


Ct. 2 on 15CF103 & Ct. 1 on 15CF259 to run concurrent
- S/W 3 years probation with conditions
- AODA and follow through with any recommended treatment
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- DE to testify fully and truthfully against DE in case 15CF102
- Court costs of $268 on each count and only a $250 DNA Surcharge on 15CF259.  Apply money on file and return balance to payor
- DE to report to probation today no later than 4:00 p.m.  
- 20 days to appeal
Def's copy of NOH returned from PO; Attempted not known. km

to Janelle Wheeler ck# 024875 sent this date. eif

*Amended*

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-Report every Wednesday and Saturday before 5:00pm  to St Croix County Jail for UA testing, in the presence of an officer or deputy of the same sex.  If UA tests positive defendant shall submit to additional evidentiary testing to determine the use of substances forbidden by this bond agreement at the jail or Hudson Hospital.  Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each test.

-Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each UA test with an officer of the same sex.

CO: RMW; REP: Drost; CLERK: Liddle ADA:   Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Alex Stormont   DF:  Rob Wayne Graves appeared from jail. Case called at 2:35 p.m.   State calls Deputy Curtis Johnson to the stand. S/T Deputy Curtis Johnson. Employed at the St Croix CO. Jail. ADA McKinley asks the court to take judicial notice of bonds in cases 15CF103 and 15CF237. Court will take judicial notice. ADA McKinley directs Deputy Johnson. Deputy identifies defendant in the courtroom. Cross by Atty Stormont. Redirect by ADA McKinley. Witness excused at 2:44 p.m. No further witnesses or argument by either party. Court finds probable cause and binds the DE over for trial. ADA McKinley will set for an arraignment and file information within 30 days. Atty Stormont would like to address bond. State does oppose modification of bond and may refile case that was dismissed. Atty Stormont makes argument. Court will not modify bond at this time. hml  Arraignment scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Appointing Atty Stormont. km
